result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew W Arbogast was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew W Arbogast is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew W Arbogast was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.  Balance due of $43.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court is not opposed to the defendant serving the sentence in another county.  Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew W Arbogast

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:11 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Ray Edelstein.

Court reads agreement - dismiss count 1 - plea to count 2.  DA concurs.  Attorney Edelstein concurs.  DA moves to dismiss the repeater on count 2.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 2.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 (disorderly conduct - domestic) and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  DA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Edelstein.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to 60 days county jail - 2 days sentence credit - commence within 60 days - no opposition to out-of-county service - with huber.
Pay court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders bond on file be applied towards the costs - any balance to be refunded.
Court dismisses count 1.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.
(VIA FAX) from Atty Ray Edelstein requesting the hearing scheduled on October 21, 2014 be rescheduled due to a confict
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

3:35 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Ray Edelstein.

Statement by Attorney Edelstein - no agreement at this time.  

Court directs case be set for Plea/Sentencing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

2:27 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Ray Edelstein.

Statement by Attorney Edelstein.

Court orders matter be set for Plea/Sentencing and to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:28 p.m.
State's

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to have NO abusive/violent contact with Samantha R.  Parties are not to co-habitate together.
Status hearing on July 29, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to have NO abusive/violent contact with Samantha R.  Parties are not to co-habitate together.

1:41 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Ray Edelstein.

Statement by Attorney Edelstein.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Edelstein.  Attorney Edelstein confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Edelstein enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to all counts.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Statement by Attorney Edelstein - requests a modification of the bond regarding the no contact order.  Statement by ADA - opposes the request.  Court questions Samantha R.  

Court modifies bond - no abusive/violent contact with Samantha R.  Parties are not to co-habitate together.  All other conditions of bond remain the same.

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.

Status hearing on June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

10:09 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Ray Edelstein.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Edelstein to file a Notice of Retainer.  Atty Edelstein & defendant have received a copy of the amended criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court goes over penalties and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Edelstein waives the time limits.  Court will set for status of prelim in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.

Matthew called Clerks office requesting that the status hearing be scheduled after 10:30 am.  Defendant was informed that the time could not be changed. Defendant stated he may be getting an attorney by 05-16-14 and he would have his attorney get the time changed.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to have NO contact with Samantha R.    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 1:06 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, without an attorney.

Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney.

Court orders bond set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions of:  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    NO contact with the victim - Samantha R.    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court allows defendant to go to the residence to obtain his personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing and it's time limits.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court directs Status Hearing, regarding preliminary, to be held on May 19, 2014 at 10:00 a.m.  and Preliminary Hearing set for May 27, 2014 - no time given right now.

Court adjourned at 1:13 p.m.
